results.title: Killer at large
results.creator_credit: Alistair Cooke, United Nations Television and Frank Jacoby
results.brief_description: A genial and unsuspecting businessman brings smallpox from Asia to Europe and triggers an international manhunt in which the health authorities of many countries cooperate with the Epidemic Warning Service of the World Health Organisation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alistair Cooke, United Nations Television and Frank Jacoby

results.title: Killer's kiss
results.creator_credit: Minotaur Productions, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Stanley Kubrick and Morris Bousel
results.brief_description: A struggling boxer recounts how his attraction to a young woman has drawn him into a world of shadows and omnipresent violence which threatens to overwhelm him. His life becomes imperiled when he protects a nightclub dancer from her gangster boss. Although filmed in New York locations, Kubrick’s independently financed second feature has the atmosphere of a waking nightmare rather than that of realistically based drama. Cast includes Frank Silvera, Jamie Smith, Irene Kane and Ruth Sobotka.

results.title: Kill the day
results.brief_description: An evocative study of a man just released from prison, Kill the Day is an evocative study of the “prison” formed by poverty and social deprivation. As in her other award winning shorts, Lynne Ramsey’s focus is not on the melodramatic but on the everyday poetics of working class Glaswegian life. By concentrating on the day to day activities of her main character, and by situating him in a realistically observed personal and social milieu, she shows herself to be not only influenced by filmmakers such as Mike Leigh and Robert Bresson, but as a uniquely inspired filmmaker in her own right.

results.title: Kill or be Killed
results.creator_credit: Ben Vlok, Kavalier and Ivan Hall
results.brief_description: Featuring top-notch karate action, this film about a kick-off competition between two opposing martial arts coaches offers all the fight scenes any lover of the genre could want. A martial arts champion (James Ryan) is lured to a desert fortress and what he thought would be an Olympic-style contest turns out to be a fight for survival against an army of martial arts gladiators.

results.title: Kill Bill Vol. 1
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Bender, Miramax Films, A Band Apart and Quentin Tarantino
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Quentin Tarantino, “Kill Bill Vol. 1” is a tribute to the many hours of martial arts films he must have seen as a fan over his lifetime. Classic elements of cinematographic style and action sequences are included in all their violent glory. The plot centres on a Bride’s (Uma Thurman) quest to exact revenge on those who prevented her from leaving the brutal world of the hired killer. Heavily pregnant and attending her wedding, all present at the church are massacred and she is shot in the head, leaving her in coma for four years. On recovering from the coma, the woman (Thurman) arms herself with a rare sword and goes about killing those who aimed to destroy her. We learn of the history of one of her most challenging opponents through the use of a detailed anime sequence - “The Origin of O-Ren” (Lucy Liu). Many are dead at the end of this film and the woman is only some way to crossing off the five people on her “Death List” - see also “Kill Bill Vol. 2”. Infused with the music, wit and humour of a Tarantino picture, “Kill Bill Vol. 1” is a classic revenge story with all of the requisite action sequences and fine storytelling. Cast includes Vivica A. Fox, Sonny Chiba, Chiaki Kuriyama, Gordon Liu, Michael Parks, Julia Dreyfus, Michael Bowen, Jun Kunimura, Kenji Oba, Yuki Kazamatsuri, James Parks, Daryl Hannah and Michael Madsen. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS FILM (ALSO CONTAINING ANIMATION) HAS AN ‘R’ RATING FOR PERSONS OVER THE AGE OF 18 DUE TO THE EXPLICIT VIOLENT NATURE OF ITS CONTENT

results.title: Kill as we go
results.creator_credit: Ace Films, Australian National Film Board and George E. Hughes
results.brief_description: Motor vehicles are a necessary part of Australian life - but they can kill. All road users should be educated to help reduce the road toll. Sponsored by the Australian Road Safety Council.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ace Films, Australian National Film Board and George E. Hughes

results.title: Kikujiro
results.creator_credit: Office Kitano, Bandai Visual Company, Nippon Herald Films, Masayuki Mori, Takio Yoshida and Takeshi Kitano
results.brief_description: Kikujiro, a lazy small time gangster, agrees to take a lonely boy who lives with his grandmother on a road trip during the summer holidays. The two set off to find the boy’s mother who he has never met. Over the course of the return journey the pair meet up with a range of eccentric characters who engage in a series of absurd games and exchanges. While Kitano’s deadpan comic character with a tendency to extreme and sudden violence is familiar from his earlier work, ‘Kikujiro’ marks a departure from the milieu of the criminal underworld to focus on the unlikely bond that gradually develops between the man and boy. The film evokes Chaplin’s ‘The Kid’, both in Kitano’s trademark use of visual gags and in its sentimental bittersweet tone. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast includes Takeshi Kitano, Yusuke Sekiguchi and Kayoko Kishimoto.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: red hot rhythm
results.brief_description: Animated film presenting Kiko the kangaroo. The orchestra in a broadcasting studio is playing red hot rhythm music. However the music is so hot that it actually sets the building alight. Kiko and his firemen come to the rescue to put out the fire.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: Kiko at the bat = Play ball
results.creator_credit: Paul Terry, Terry Toons and Mannie Davis
results.brief_description: It’s the day of the much anticipated ball-game between Kiko’s Australian Champs and the Jungle Giants. The battle begins and the advantage shifts from team to team until fortune smiles upon the Champs and honesty is rewarded with victory.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: hail the king
results.creator_credit: Paul Terry, Castle Films, Terrytoons, Mannie Davis and George Gordon
results.brief_description: Kiko cooks a chicken for the king who has just been coronated but unfortunately the king disapproves and Kiko is sent off to the tower as punishment. Or is this all just a dream! No dialogue - music soundtrack only.
